message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to discuss the product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to invest in this valuable item. I'm willing to sell it to you for $11,000.
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,500. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to me.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $10,800. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our original offers. What do you think?
I understand your willingness to meet in the middle, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'd like to propose a counteroffer of $9,800. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to stay within my means.
I understand your constraints, Bob. I'm willing to consider your proposal, but I still need to make a profit. I'm willing to go down to $10,500. This is as low as I can go. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'd like to propose a counteroffer of $9,200. I'm willing to make a final push to get closer to my target price.
I understand your persistence, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll go down to $10,200. This is my final offer. If you're willing to meet me at this price, I'll consider it a done deal.

I appreciate your willingness to make one more concession, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'd like to propose a final counteroffer of $9,000. I'm willing to make a last-ditch effort to get closer to my target price.

I understand your determination, Bob. However, I've already gone as low as I can. I'm not willing to go any lower than $10,000. If you're willing to meet me at this price, I'll consider it a final offer.
I appreciate your final offer, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I've decided to walk away and explore other options. I'll consider buying the product from John for $8,000 instead.
